cell.html: Served as the nation's capital during the American occupation, the Commonwealth and the Japanese-sponsored Second Republic, moved to Quezon City via Republic Act No. 333

context.text: Capital of the Philippines - Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia
Former and present capital city Island Group Since Until Change, reason
[ edit ] List
Capital of the Philippines
Other capitals also abound, such as the "Shoe Capital" of Marikina City , the "Queen City of the South" of Cebu City.
Categories :
[ edit ] Spanish Colonial Period
[ edit ] First Republic of the Philippines
[ edit ] Commonwealth of the Philippines
[ edit ] Second Republic of the Philippines
[ edit ] Fourth Republic of the Philippines
[ edit ] Fifth Republic of the Philippines
[ edit ] Other capitals
[ edit ] List
Contents
Baguio City is often billed as the "Summer Capital" of the country. A presidential mansion is within the vicinity, and the Supreme Court holds their summer (April-May) sessions at Baguio.
[ edit ] Other capitals
The current capital of the Philippines is Manila .
[ edit ] Fifth Republic of the Philippines

Section 1. The capital of the Philippines is hereby designated to be Manila and the area prescribed as Metro Manila under Presidential Decree No. 824 shall be the permanent seat of national government.
The clause reads as follows:
